result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:35 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Arne Richard Skatrud in court for Sarah L. Gibson. Attorney Angela Raye Olson in court for Sarah L. Gibson. Defendant Sarah L. Gibson in court. Court reviews case. S/T Detective de la Cruz. Direct by ADA Becker. Record to reflect the identity of DE. O/R PL Exhibit 1, 2, 3, 4. Cross by Atty Olson. O/R DE Exhibit 5. Redirect by ADA Becker. Recross by Atty Olson. Redirect by ADA Becker. Court orders briefs. ADA Becker requests Transcript. ADA Becker to submit brief by 11/14, Atty Olson to reply by 12/05/22, and Reply by 12/16/22. Court sets ORR. Court to adjust scheduling order as needed if Court Reporter does not have Transcript prepared by 10/14/22. Bond Continues. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 10:47 AM.

10:02 AM  Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy   ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Arne Richard Skatrud appeared by video means   DF:  Sarah Lee Gibson appeared in person.  DF Atty Angela Oson appearaed in person with Sarah Lee Gibson.  State calls New Richmond Detective Carlos De La Cruz.  Witness sworn.  State direct.  Witness identifies DF.  Atty Olson cross.  Atty Skatrud cross.  Redirect.  Witness excused.  State argument.  Atty Olson argument.  Atty Skatrud argument.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Bond continues.  Court confirms address. to Appear Remotely, filed by Atty Arne Richard Skatrud.   Approved; JA notified Atty Skatrud.  mw
Preliminary hearing on February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Continuance Letter for 2/23/22 Preliminary Hearing, filed by DA.  gll
Per SRN, If no objection, reset w/ attys. JA rescheduled. js/km
Preliminary hearing on February 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  B.J.A.D.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

No intentional contact with juvenile males under the age of 18, except her own family.

No use of social media platforms.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:05 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Angela Raye Olson   DF:  Sarah L. Gibson appeared. DE updates address and confirms DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets Preliminary Hearing. Adjourned at 1:11 PM.  gll  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
